allowDots.description: Determines if dots should be used for serialization object properties. Otherwise brackets will be used

arrayFormat.description: Determines how arrays should be serialized

GlobalModifiers.description: Global modifiers for parameters. It gives flexibility to adjust the OpenAPI spec before it is processed

parameters.description: Global-level modifiers for parameters with a matching name

additionalProperties.description: Modify the parameter in the following way: `optional` - make the parameter optional, `required` - make the parameter required, `ignore` - remove the parameter from the operations

out.description: The path to the file where the API would be generated. Use stdout if left empty.

src.description: The url or path to the Open API spec file. Both JSON and YAML are supported

template.description: Template that will be used for generating the API client. You can reference bundled templates by name or provide path to the custom template as well

baseUrl.description: Base URL that will be used as a default value in the clients

servicePrefix.description: Prefix for service names. Useful when you have multiple APIs and you want to avoid name collisions

skipDeprecated.description: Skip deprecated operations. When enabled, deprecated operations will be skipped from the generated code

dateFormat.description: It determines how Date fields will be handled and what type they will have in models

nullableStrategy.description: Controls how OpenAPI 'nullable' is translated into TypeScript types
